cola: Coca-Cola sells so many drinks worldwide that they had to invent a measurement called 'Share of Throat' to measure their profit margins.
scarecrows: The original name for scarecrows were 'Hobidy-Booby!'
numbers: If you wrote out, or said every number in order, the first time the letter 'b' appears would be in the number one billion.
groups: A group of pugs is called a grumble, a group of ferrets are a business, and a group of jellyfish are a smack!
letters: Every single letter in the alphabet only has one syllable- the letter itself! That is of course aside from W, which has three.
